channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: There’s One Glaring Problem With The New ‘Zelda: Echoes Of Wisdom’ Nintendo Game Where You Play As Zelda
item.description: The Legend Of Zelda: Echoes Of Wisdom is missing one of the things that makes 'Zelda' games great.

item.title: Leprechauns
item.description: Is there a rainbow underneath your pot of gold? Sometimes, we get it backwards.

item.title: Cheaper Apple Vision Pro Headset May Have One Key Drawback
item.description: In order to cut down costs, Apple's upcoming more affordable Vision Pro headset may require another Apple PC or mobile device to be nearby.

item.title: Assume lack of context
item.description: The person you’re working with might not know what you know, might not see what you see. It’s tempting to begin where we are. But it’s more useful to ...

item.title: IBM Develops The AI-Quantum Link
item.description: IBM is using its watsonx generative AI platform, leveraging the company’s Granite AI model, to generate digital agents...

item.title: The Coney Island problem
item.description: Disney theme parks created more than 20 billion dollars in revenue last year. Coney Island, not so much. Coney Island is dozens of small honky tonk ve...

item.title: Who Is Responsible For Space Debris Falling On Your Home? Florida Family Sues NASA To Find Out
item.description: A Florida family sued NASA after a piece of trash from the International Space Station fell on and damaged their home.

item.title: The Western Union trap
item.description: When the telephone began to gain traction, the monopoly of the time, Western Union, decided to get even better at sending telegrams.

item.title: When Do New ‘House Of The Dragon’ Episodes Land On HBO And Max? Full Season 2 Release Schedule
item.description: Everything you need to know about House Of The Dragon season 2 and when new episodes drop on HBO and Max.

item.title: The near future (and summer reads)
